preqs: ASP2062 and one of MTH2010 or MTH2015 orENG2005 and one of MTH2032 or MTH2040.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ASP2062, MTH2032} and  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {MTH2010, MTH2015})
(Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ASP2062} and  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ENG2005, MTH2010, MTH2015} and  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {MTH2032, MTH2040})

unitName: Computational astrophysics and the extreme universe
description: In this unit students will learn the basic principles of astrophysical fluid dynamics and how it can be used to model the most extreme events in the universe. The unit covers the basic equations of compressible hydrodynamics, including the behaviour of linear waves, the transition to shocks and the behaviour of fluids at high Mach number. Students will apply this to understand the physical processes that power accreting sources including white dwarfs, neutron stars and black holes, and the physics behind the explosion of stars as supernovae. Students will gain practical experience in computational fluid dynamics including basic programming skills and an understanding of how large scale astrophysical simulations are performed.Students will also learn about high-energy observational techniques of supernova remnants and compact objects and statistical approaches for inference-based interpretation of high-energy observational data.
